Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: mypy
Description: Mypy is a static type checker for Python

Arguments.Name: --module
Arguments.Description: Asks mypy to type check the provided module

Arguments.Name: --package
Arguments.Description: Asks mypy to type check the provided package

Arguments.Name: --command
Arguments.Description: Asks mypy to type check the provided string as a program

Arguments.Name: --exclude
Arguments.Description: A regular expression that matches file names, directory names and paths which mypy should ignore while recursively discovering files to check

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help message and exit

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: More verbose messages

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Show program's version number and exit

Arguments.Name: --config-file
Arguments.Description: This flag makes mypy read configuration settings from the given file

Arguments.Name: --warn-unused-configs
Arguments.Description: This flag makes mypy warn about unused [mypy-<pattern>] config file sections

Arguments.Name: --explicit-package-bases
Arguments.Description: This flag tells mypy that top-level packages will be based in either the current directory, or a member of the MYPYPATH environment variable

Arguments.Name: --ignore-missing-imports
Arguments.Description: This flag makes mypy ignore all missing imports

Arguments.Name: silent
Arguments.Description: This flag adjusts how mypy follows imported modules that were not explicitly passed in via the command line

Arguments.Name: --python-executable
Arguments.Description: This flag will have mypy collect type information from PEP561 compliant packages installed for the Python executable EXECUTABLE

Arguments.Name: --no-site-packages
Arguments.Description: This flag will disable searching for PEP561 compliant packages

Arguments.Name: --no-silence-site-packages
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy will suppress any error messages generated within PEP561 compliant packages

Arguments.Name: --fast-module-lookup
Arguments.Description: The default logic used to scan through search paths to resolve imports has a quadratic worse-case behavior in some cases, which is for instance triggered by a large number of folders sharing

Arguments.Name: --no-namespace-packages
Arguments.Description: This flag disables import discovery of namespace packages (see PEP420)

Arguments.Name: --python-version
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy type check your code as if it were run under Python version X

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy type check your code as if it were run under the given operating system

Arguments.Name: --always-true
Arguments.Description: This flag will treat all variables named NAME as compile-time constants that are always true

Arguments.Name: --always-false
Arguments.Description: This flag will treat all variables named NAME as compile-time constants that are always false

Arguments.Name: --disallow-any-unimported
Arguments.Description: This flag disallows usage of types that come from unfollowed imports (such types become aliases for Any)

Arguments.Name: --disallow-any-expr
Arguments.Description: This flag disallows all expressions in the module that have type Any

Arguments.Name: --disallow-any-decorated
Arguments.Description: This flag disallows functions that have Any in their signature after decorator transformation

Arguments.Name: --disallow-any-explicit
Arguments.Description: This flag disallows explicit Any in type positions such as type annotations and generic type parameters

Arguments.Name: --disallow-any-generics
Arguments.Description: This flag disallows usage of generic types that do not specify explicit type parameters

Arguments.Name: --disallow-subclassing-any
Arguments.Description: This flag reports an error whenever a class subclasses a value of type Any

Arguments.Name: --disallow-untyped-calls
Arguments.Description: This flag reports an error whenever a function with type annotations calls a function defined without annotations

Arguments.Name: --untyped-calls-exclude
Arguments.Description: This flag allows to selectively disable option--disallow-untyped-calls for functions and methods defined in specific packages, modules, or classes

Arguments.Name: --disallow-untyped-defs
Arguments.Description: This flag reports an error whenever it encounters a function definition without type annotations or with incomplete type annotations

Arguments.Name: --disallow-incomplete-defs
Arguments.Description: This flag reports an error whenever it encounters a partly annotated function definition, while still allowing entirely unannotated definitions

Arguments.Name: --check-untyped-defs
Arguments.Description: This flag is less severe than the previous two options -- it type checks the body of every function, regardless of whether it has type annotations

Arguments.Name: --disallow-untyped-decorators
Arguments.Description: This flag reports an error whenever a function with type annotations is decorated with a decorator without annotations

Arguments.Name: --implicit-optional
Arguments.Description: This flag causes mypy to treat arguments with a None default value as having an implicit pydata~typing

Arguments.Name: --no-strict-optional
Arguments.Description: This flag disables strict checking of pydata~typing

Arguments.Name: --warn-redundant-casts
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy report an error whenever your code uses an unnecessary cast that can safely be removed

Arguments.Name: --warn-unused-ignores
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy report an error whenever your code uses a # type ignore comment on a line that is not actually generating an error message

Arguments.Name: --no-warn-no-return
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy will generate errors when a function is missing return statements in some execution paths

Arguments.Name: --warn-return-any
Arguments.Description: This flag causes mypy to generate a warning when returning a value with type Any from a function declared with a non-Any return type

Arguments.Name: --warn-unreachable
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy report an error whenever it encounters code determined to be unreachable or redundant after performing type analysis

Arguments.Name: --allow-untyped-globals
Arguments.Description: This flag causes mypy to suppress errors caused by not being able to fully infer the types of global and class variables

Arguments.Name: --allow-redefinition
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy won't allow a variable to be redefined with an unrelated type

Arguments.Name: --local-partial-types
Arguments.Description: In mypy, the most common cases for partial types are variables initialized using None, but without explicit Optional annotations

Arguments.Name: --no-implicit-reexport
Arguments.Description: By default, imported values to a module are treated as exported and mypy allows other modules to import them

Arguments.Name: --strict-equality
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy allows always-false comparisons like 42 == 'no'

Arguments.Name: --extra-checks
Arguments.Description: This flag enables additional checks that are technically correct but may be impractical in real code

Arguments.Name: --strict
Arguments.Description: This flag mode enables all optional error checking flags

Arguments.Name: --disable-error-code
Arguments.Description: This flag allows disabling one or multiple error codes globally

Arguments.Name: --enable-error-code
Arguments.Description: This flag allows enabling one or multiple error codes globally

Arguments.Name: --show-error-context
Arguments.Description: This flag will precede all errors with 'note' messages explaining the context of the error

Arguments.Name: --show-column-numbers
Arguments.Description: This flag will add column offsets to error messages

Arguments.Name: --show-error-end
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy show not just that start position where an error was detected, but also the end position of the relevant expression

Arguments.Name: --hide-error-codes
Arguments.Description: This flag will hide the error code [<code>] from error messages

Arguments.Name: --pretty
Arguments.Description: Use visually nicer output in error messages use soft word wrap, show source code snippets, and show error location markers

Arguments.Name: --no-color-output
Arguments.Description: This flag will disable color output in error messages, enabled by default

Arguments.Name: --no-error-summary
Arguments.Description: This flag will disable error summary

Arguments.Name: --show-absolute-path
Arguments.Description: Show absolute paths to files

Arguments.Name: --soft-error-limit
Arguments.Description: This flag will adjust the limit after which mypy will (sometimes) disable reporting most additional errors

Arguments.Name: --no-incremental
Arguments.Description: This flag disables incremental mode mypy will no longer reference the cache when re-run

Arguments.Name: --cache-dir
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy stores all cache data inside of a folder named

Arguments.Name: --sqlite-cache
Arguments.Description: Use an SQLite_ database to store the cache

Arguments.Name: --cache-fine-grained
Arguments.Description: Include fine-grained dependency information in the cache for the mypy daemon

Arguments.Name: --skip-version-check
Arguments.Description: By default, mypy will ignore cache data generated by a different version of mypy

Arguments.Name: --skip-cache-mtime-checks
Arguments.Description: Skip cache internal consistency checks based on mtime

Arguments.Name: --pdb
Arguments.Description: This flag will invoke the Python debugger when mypy encounters a fatal error

Arguments.Name: --tb
Arguments.Description: If set, this flag will display a full traceback when mypy encounters a fatal error

Arguments.Name: --raise-exceptions
Arguments.Description: Raise exception on fatal error

Arguments.Name: --custom-typing-module
Arguments.Description: This flag lets you use a custom module as a substitute for the pymodtyping module

Arguments.Name: --custom-typeshed-dir
Arguments.Description: This flag specifies the directory where mypy looks for standard library typeshed stubs, instead of the typeshed that ships with mypy

Arguments.Name: --warn-incomplete-stub
Arguments.Description: This flag modifies both the option--disallow-untyped-defs and option--disallow-incomplete-defs flags so they also report errors if stubs in typeshed are missing type annotations or has incomplete annotations

Arguments.Name: --shadow-file
Arguments.Description: When mypy is asked to type check SOURCE_FILE, this flag makes mypy read from and type check the contents of SHADOW_FILE instead

Arguments.Name: --any-exprs-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a text file report documenting how many expressions of type Any are present within your codebase

Arguments.Name: --cobertura-xml-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a Cobertura XML type checking coverage report

Arguments.Name: --html-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate an HTML type checking coverage report

Arguments.Name: --linecount-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a text file report documenting the functions and lines that are typed and untyped within your codebase

Arguments.Name: --linecoverage-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a JSON file that maps each source file's absolute filename to a list of line numbers that belong to typed functions in that file

Arguments.Name: --lineprecision-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a flat text file report with per-module statistics of how many lines are typechecked etc

Arguments.Name: --txt-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a text file type checking coverage report

Arguments.Name: --xml-report
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate an XML type checking coverage report

Arguments.Name: --install-types
Arguments.Description: This flag causes mypy to install known missing stub packages for third-party libraries using pip

Arguments.Name: --non-interactive
Arguments.Description: When used together with option--install-types <mypy --install-types>, this causes mypy to install all suggested stub packages using pip without asking for confirmation, and then continues to perform type checking using the installed stubs, if some files or modules are provided to type check

Arguments.Name: --junit-xml
Arguments.Description: Causes mypy to generate a JUnit XML test result document with type checking results

Arguments.Name: --find-occurrences
Arguments.Description: This flag will make mypy print out all usages of a class member based on static type information

Arguments.Name: --scripts-are-modules
Arguments.Description: This flag will give command line arguments that appear to be scripts
